mdRecord.dcterms:title: George Washington's Home, Mount Vernon VA
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Photographer unknown
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Glass plate negative of the mansion. Photograph of the south and east fa√ßades of the Mount Vernon Mansion, 1858. The view is taken from the southeast lawn and shows the mansion in a dilapidated state with ship masts holding up the sagging piazza. Several individuals are posing in the photograph: (from left to right) - a young African American woman stands on the stairs to the south porch, a white male stands leaning next to a tree, an elderly African-American man is seated on the corner of the piazza next to the Mansion, an African-American woman surrounded by four young children is also seated on the piazza, leaning against one of the ship mast supports stands an African-American man, and lastly, an African-American man holding a hat stands on the east lawn near the piazza. A faint figure of a woman or child stands inside the window of the room (study) nearest the piazza. While all of the subjects are currently unidentified there is a possibility that the elderly gentleman seated on
